::KitKit::
She stopped in her tracks and thought about what she had overheard 
Drillbit mumble.  She hadn't realized that that her actions were that 
of a maximal.  She looked at Drillbit. "Yeah, but then, would you 
rather we did nothing and no longer exist?"

Feline::
Chuckling at HotRod's comment, she hooked up a small cable to the 
back of his mind and hooked him up to the mainframe.  She walked 
around the console and stood facing the console, with HotRod laying 
on the table a few feet away.  She pressed a few buttons and started 
to download all the information from HotRod's memory banks.  She 
smirked and pressed a few more buttons, sending a sleeping program to 
HotRod. He should sleep for a few hours, she thought.  She knew that 
the downloading of all the info would take a while.  And she knew how 
HotRod's mind worked. He'd get bored quickly and to make things 
easier on all, she wold just have him sleep for a while.  When he'd 
wake up, he's only feel refreshed and lively.  She started wondering 
if she really cared about him.  She had to admit to herself that she 
felt something, but under the Predacon code, you didn't care for 
anyone.  But she had to admit that she felt something. 



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, RoboRick007 <rfa007@h...> wrote:
> ::DrillBit::
> 
> He cought up with KitKat, and walked next to her, still in insect 
mode.
> "So Megatron is trying to wipe us all out. Along with every 
important
> Transformer every, and 500 years of history. Heh, and here we are
> deciding to save everything. We are starting to act like Maximals or
> Autobots, or something like that." He shuttered.
> "Man this is wierd."
> 
> ::Hot Rod::
> 
> He layed on the bed.
> "Ok. Hmmm. This is a good position for us to interface, in a...
> differant
> way." He said, in a humorus laugh.
